Welcome to pymangal’s documentation!¶

Contents:

class pymangal.mangal(url='http://mangal.uqar.ca', usr=None, pwd=None)¶

Handles connection to the API

This is the main class used by pymangal. When called, it will return an object with all methods and attributes required to interact with the database.

Get(resource='dataset', key='1')¶

Get an object identified by its key (id)

Parameters:
  • resource – The type of object to get
  • key – The unique identifier of the object

Usage :: >>> import pymangal >>> mg = pymangal.mangal() >>> mg.Get(‘taxa’, ‘1’)

List(resource='dataset', filters=None, autopage=False)¶

Lists all objects of a given resource type, according to a filter

Args: :param resource: The type of resource :param filters: A string giving the filtering criteria :param autopage: A boolean (default False) telling whether all the results, or just the first 20, should be returned.

The filters string should be formated in the following way: a field, or path through fields, a relation, and a target. For example, name__contains=phyto is a valid filter.

Returns:
objects (array): An array of objects, each being a dict
Post(resource='taxa', data=None)¶

Post a resource to the database

Parameters:
  • resource – The type of object to post
  • data – The dict representation of the object

Using the Post method requires that you gave a username and password.

The data may or may not contain an owner key. If so, it must be the URI of the owner object. If no owner key is present, the value used will be self.owner.

If the request is successful, this method will return the newly created object. If not, it will print the reply from the server and fail.
